Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif and concerns a motor vehicle accident referenced in the subject as occurring on November 8, 2022, with additional activity related to a separate incident on December 9, 2022. The note summarizes a series of email communications between Muhammad Alif and The Whaley Law Firm (Sarena M. Tuttle and Aaron Whaley, with Justin Chumbley CC’d) as they pursued documents, insurance information, and medical updates related to these accidents.

On January 4, 2023, at 7:45 PM UTC, Muhammad Alif sent an email from stimulus110@yahoo.com to Sarena Tuttle and Aaron Whaley, CC’ing Justin Chumbley. In that message he requested a copy of the police report and noted that he had just sent a copy of the exchange of information; the message was sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone. The subject line of the thread referenced the November 8, 2022 motor vehicle accident.

Earlier that same day, at 2:34 PM, Sarena Tuttle replied stating that she had received the item earlier and had spoken with him again a few minutes earlier. She added that he was flying to Florida that night for a “special MRI to be included in both my accidents.”

At 2:30 PM on January 4, 2023, Aaron Whaley sent a message to Sarena and Justin indicating that they had the information necessary to request a copy of the police report and that he had attached it.

Earlier on January 4, 2023, at 12:00 PM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Mo (Muhammad Alif) thanking him for updating his providers with her that afternoon. She acknowledged that he had been at an appointment and had to cut the call short, but emphasized that they still needed documents related to the December 9, 2022 accident. She requested that he forward the police report and any other claim information as soon as possible to help complete their investigation.

The notes also include a prior December 22, 2022, 12:41 PM communication from Sarena Tuttle. In that message, she thanked Mo for speaking with her in more detail about the accident. She attached an email from West Bend Mutual Insurance Company indicating that Bodily Injury benefits would be provided in this claim, and that according to Ryan Gorelick the claim had been 100% accepted. She asked Mo to provide a complete list of medical providers he had seen for this accident and noted that he had visited a hospital in Tennessee and was currently receiving treatment with KORT Physical Therapy and seeing a neurologist. She requested specific names and addresses for the hospital in Tennessee and the neurologist. She also acknowledged Mo’s December 9, 2022 incident and offered to help with that as well, requesting any information related to that incident for a deeper review. She invited Mo to contact her with any questions.

The note closes with the contact details for The Whaley Law Firm. Aaron Whaley is listed as part of the Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the telephone number 502-583-4022. Sarena M. Tuttle’s contact information is provided as well: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting a new email address). The firm’s general listing also cites the same address and phone number.

In summary, the communications document a coordinated effort to obtain the police report for the December 9, 2022 accident, to gather and document medical providers and treatment related to the related accidents, and to share insurance information (including West Bend Mutual Insurance Company’s indication of Bodily Injury benefits being accepted). They also note the client’s travel to Florida for a special MRI intended to address both accidents, and they reflect ongoing correspondence among Muhammad Alif and The Whaley Law Firm, including the delivery of the police report attachment and requests for additional claim documents.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. This file documents communications concerning Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accident on November 8, 2022, and a related incident on December 9, 2022, involving Muhammad and The Whaley Law Firm, represented by Sarena M. Tuttle along with colleagues Aaron Whaley and Justin Chumbley.

The timeline centers on the December 22, 2022 through January 4, 2023 communications. On December 22, 2022, Sarena Tuttle informed Muhammad that West Bend Mutual Insurance Company would provide bodily injury benefits for his claim and that the claim had been 100% accepted. She requested a complete list of medical providers Muhammad had seen for this accident, noting that he had visited a hospital in Tennessee and was currently receiving treatment with KORT Physical Therapy and seeing a neurologist. She asked for the specific names and addresses of the Tennessee hospital and the neurologist. She also acknowledged awareness of Muhammad’s December 9, 2022 incident and offered to help with that matter as well, asking him to forward any information related to that incident for a deeper review. She closed by inviting questions and providing her contact details.

Subsequently, on January 4, 2023, the firm continued to press for documentation related to the December 9, 2022 accident. At 12:00 PM, Sarena wrote that she appreciated Muhammad updating his providers with her that afternoon and reiterated that they still needed the documents related to the December 9 incident, specifically the police report and any other claim information necessary to complete their investigation.

Later that day, at 2:30 PM, Aaron Whaley replied that they had the information required to request a copy of the police report and stated that he had attached it. At 2:34 PM, Sarena responded that she had received something earlier that day and had spoken with him again moments earlier; she noted that Muhammad would be flying to Florida that night for a “special MRI to be included in both my accidents.” In the same thread, at 2:45 PM, Muhammad replied that he would like to have a copy of the police report and that he had sent a copy of the exchange of information.

Finally, at 3:02 PM, Sarena confirmed that there were instructions to order the police report, that the firm would place the order, and that a copy would be forwarded to Muhammad upon receipt. The communications throughout this period reflect ongoing efforts to obtain the police report, secure documentation related to the December 9, 2022 accident, and coordinate medical and insurance related matters, including Muhammad’s stated travel to Florida for a special MRI to be included in both accidents. The Whaley Law Firm listed its contact information in the signatures of these communications.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

episodes.natural_language:
Muhammad Alif, represented by The Whaley Law Firm, is involved in two motor vehicle accidents: the first on November 8, 2022 and the second on December 9, 2022, the latter occurring in New York. The team has been coordinating police reports, medical information, and insurance benefits related to these incidents. In late December 2022, the firm noted that West Bend Mutual Insurance Company had accepted bodily injury benefits for the claim, and they requested a full list of medical providers Muhammad had seen for the accident, including a hospital in Tennessee, the Tennessee hospital and its address, the neurologist, and the multi-provider treatment history, while also acknowledging the December 9, 2022 incident and offering to assist with that matter as well. Ryan Gorelick indicated that the bodily injury claim was 100% accepted.

On December 22, 2022, Sarena Tuttle emailed Muhammad to follow up after a detailed phone conversation. She attached the email from West Bend Mutual Insurance, confirming the accepted Bodily Injury benefits. She asked Muhammad to provide a complete list of medical providers seen for the accident, noting visits to a hospital in Tennessee, ongoing treatment with KORT Physical Therapy, and a neurologist, and she requested the specific names and addresses of the Tennessee hospital and the neurologist. She also indicated awareness of the December 9, 2022 incident and expressed willingness to help with that matter as well, asking Muhammad to forward any information he had related to that incident for a deeper review. The message closed with her standard contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS). The firm was also represented by Aaron Whaley, Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40225; phone number 502-583-4022.

Between December 22 and January 4, 2023, communications continued to focus on gathering and submitting documentation to advance the investigation. On January 4, 2023, at 12:00 PM, Sarena wrote to Muhammad thanking him for updating his providers and reminding him that they still needed documents related to the December 9, 2022 accident. She requested that he forward the police report and any other claim information as soon as possible so the firm could complete its investigation.

Later on January 4, 2023, at 2:30 PM, Aaron Whaley informed Sarena and Justin that they had the information necessary to request a copy of the police report and indicated that the related document was attached. At 2:34 PM, Sarena replied that she had received the material earlier that day and had spoken with him again a few minutes earlier; she noted that Muhammad was flying to Florida that evening for a "special MRI to be included in both my accidents." 

At 2:45 PM, Muhammad responded, requesting a copy of the police report and noting that he had just sent a copy of the exchange of information. Finally, at 3:02 PM, Sarena confirmed that there were instructions to order the police report and that they would order it and forward Muhammad a copy upon receipt. 

At 8:33 PM (UTC) on January 4, 2023, Muhammad reiterated his request: regarding the New York accident, he needed the police report as soon as possible; he already had the report for the November 8 accident and needed the December 9 report specifically.

Contact details reflected in the communications include Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Direct: (502) 357-9971; Office: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; Email: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com. The firm’s communications were also signed by Aaron Whaley of The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40225; Phone: 502-583-4022.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

In a series of email exchanges from The Whaley Law Firm regarding Muhammad Alif’s motor vehicle accidents, the team worked to obtain police reports and medical claim information. The correspondence centers on two incidents: the accident on November 8, 2022, and the December 9, 2022 incident in New York, with ongoing efforts to obtain the related police report for the New York accident and to gather documentation for the December 9, 2022 claim.

On January 4, 2023 at 3:40 PM, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm informed Mr. Alif that the New York police report was not available online and that a check would need to be sent to the NY Processing Center to obtain it. She noted that the request had been drafted and was awaiting a check to cover the processing and search fees; once the check was received, the request would be sent off. Her signature included the firm’s contact details and a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS,” with her new email address listed as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

Earlier that same day, at 3:33 PM, Muhammad Alif wrote that he needed the police report for the New York accident as soon as possible, clarifying that he already had the November 8 report and needed the December 9 report. He sent this message via Yahoo Mail for iPhone.

At 3:02 PM, Sarena replied: no problem, Mo. There are instructions included for ordering the police report, which they would initiate and forward to him a copy once received. Her message again included The Whaley Law Firm’s contact information and the new email address note.

At 2:45 PM, Muhammad Alif responded that he would like a copy of the police report and that he had already sent a copy of the exchange of information.

At 2:34 PM, Sarena wrote that she had received the material earlier that day and had spoken with him again a few minutes earlier. She noted that he was flying to Florida that night for a “special MRI to be included in both my accidents.”

At 2:30 PM, Aaron Whaley replied to Sarena and Justin, stating that they had the information necessary to request a copy of the report and that it had been attached.

At 12:00 PM, Sarena sent a message to Muhammad: good afternoon, Mo. She thanked him for updating his providers with her earlier that afternoon and stated that they still needed the documents related to the December 9, 2022 accident. She asked him to forward the police report and any other claim information as soon as possible so they could complete their investigation.

On December 22, 2022 at 12:41 PM, Sarena emailed again after speaking with Mr. Alif in more detail about his accident. She attached the email from West Bend Mutual Insurance Company indicating that bodily injury benefits would be provided in the claim, and, per Ryan Gorelick, the claim had been 100% accepted. She requested a complete list of medical providers Mr. Alif had seen for the December 9 accident and noted that he had visited a hospital in Tennessee and was currently receiving treatment at KORT Physical Therapy and seeing a neurologist. She asked for the specific names and addresses of the hospital in Tennessee and the neurologist. She added that they were also aware of the December 9, 2022 incident and were ready to help with that as well, asking Mr. Alif to forward any information related to that incident for deeper review. She closed by inviting him to contact the firm with any questions. The signature block again listed Sarena M. Tuttle and The Whaley Law Firm, along with the firm’s contact details and the note about the new email address.

Throughout these exchanges, the client’s focus remained on obtaining the December 9, 2022 New York police report and providing the necessary documentation to advance the investigation into both accidents, while the firm coordinated the steps to secure the reports and review the related medical and insurance information.

episodes.natural_language: Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022 involves client Muhammad Alif. Updated Medical Providers: I reviewed the Accident Info Exchange Sheet and then called Progressive, but I was unable to locate a Claim or Policy. Following the Information Exchange Instructions, I searched for PR online; PR was not available online and can take up to 60 days. PR can be requested via Written Request; I prepared a Printed Form and Envelope. A check from AW is needed. I also sent an email and provided the Written Request and Envelope in his Inbox as part of the investigation.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif.

On January 9, 2023, at 11:02 a.m., Nona Bacote wrote to Sarena Tuttle with a detailed request to obtain all records and bills related to two motor vehicle accidents involving Muhammad Alif. She instructed that for the first accident, Park Ridge Medical Center should be contacted and that the account number is #F00116787480 under the name Muhammad Alif. The insurance provider for this accident is Farmers Insurance Company, and the claim number is 700528477781. She also noted a second accident that occurred in New York, with American Transit Insurance Company handling the case and the case number 1123215. Nona requested all records and bills from Norton Hospital in Louisville, Kentucky. She listed Legions Orthopedic Hospital, on the third floor of Cutting Edge Orthopedic Services, located at 1401 E. Trinity Mills Road, Carrollton, Texas 75006, with Gabe as the contact at (972) 978-2525. Dr. Steven Patton at Norton Hospital referred Muhammad to Kort Partners in Physical Therapy, located at 616 Executive Park, Louisville, Kentucky, and the phone number is (502) 896-9355. She stated that Muhammad had an MRI with Innovative Open MRI of Central Florida for the first accident. She also mentioned Dr. Steven Abro of Annotating Hands, with the contact (212) 857-8200 and the note “Pixie Highway Cervical.” She indicated that she was waiting on the police report for the New York accident and requested the accident report from New York, including all police statements and witnesses’ reports from both accidents. She noted that she is seeing Dr. Mark Lynn, a specialist for first accident treatment, at Lynn Family Sports Vision & Training LLC, located at 801 Edith Road, Louisville, Kentucky 40206, with the phone number (502) 308-5966. She asked that all PIP forms be completely filled out for insurance compliance, reiterated the request for copies of police statements and witnesses’ reports from both accidents, and inquired about who the insurance adjusters are for both accidents and what the policy limits are. She reminded everyone to be mindful of the travel involved to appointments. She also stated that attorney release benefits should be directed only to Starlite Chiropractic, LLC at starlightchrio@gmail.com and to Annotating Hands. She ended by thanking Aaron Whaley for his support and expressing that she is hurt and actions are needed immediately. The message was signed “Muhammand Alif.”

Later that same day, at 12:39:54 p.m., Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm responded to Nona Bacote. She thanked Nona for the detailed email and confirmed that the firm would handle obtaining all required documentation; there is nothing Nona needed to do beyond focusing on getting better. She stated that they had already requested the New York Police Report and had set up the claims for Muhammad’s first accident. The firm’s Medical Records Clerk would work on obtaining Muhammad’s medical records, and Nona should keep them posted if Muhammad treats with any new providers not already listed in the email. Regarding travel to appointments, Sarena asked for receipts to verify those expenses and reminded that Kentucky has a travel reimbursement statute that will determine the reimbursable amount. She invited any questions and provided her contact details: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct dial (502) 357-9971; office (502) 583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting the new email address).

On Monday, January 16, 2023, Muhammad Alif sent an email to Sarena Tuttle (stimulus110@yahoo.com) with the subject Re: Fw: Mayo Clinic Patient File, requesting, “Could you give me a call at your earliest convenience please.” The message was sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone and was addressed to Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm, with Jessica Bottorff copied.

Earlier that same day, at 12:52 PM, the RST Spine Center emailed Mr. Alif: “Hello Mr. Alif, As requested, your Mayo Clinic Patient ID number is 13-814-724. If you have questions about your appointment request, please call the Mayo Clinic Spine Center at 507-284-2263. Thank you.”

At 12:55 PM, Muhammad Alif sent a reply that began with “Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone” and included a forwarded message from the RST Spine Center. The forwarded message stated that the Mayo Clinic Patient ID number is 13-814-724 and provided the Mayo Clinic Spine Center contact number, 507-284-2263, with a note of thanks.

Later, at 1:02 PM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Muhammad Alif: “Good afternoon Mo, Thank you for the Patient ID number. I’m not sure if you intended to attach records but there are no records attached. I will get this over to Jessica so she can request these records.” Her message included her contact details and signature: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS).

episodes.natural_language:
Returned client call on December 9, 2022 with Muhammad Alif regarding his motor vehicle accident.

He reported that his MRI results show a herniated disc and that he has a new provider, Mayo Spine Clinic, for this condition. He also stated that he has a primary care appointment this week with Dr. Patton for the referral to Mayo Clinic. He requested copies of his LORs to be sent to him.

We discussed the NY Police Report again and advised that we are awaiting it. We also discussed BI for the NY incident and advised that Progressive stated not their Policy Number; a PR is needed to dig further.

The client tends to attempt to direct or give instructions on how to proceed. We advised that we have this covered and will do our best for him. #cc

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. Client: Muhammad Alif. This note summarizes the January 2023 email correspondence regarding Muhammad Alif (Mr. Alif) and PIP coverage for two motor vehicle incidents.

On January 23, 2023, at 8:22 AM, Brittany Clark, Call Center Manager at Aptiva Health, sent an email to Ms. Sarena Tuttle at The Whaley Law Firm. In her message, Brittany stated that Mr. Alif had been scheduled for treatment in Aptiva Health that day and indicated that the treatment related to an auto accident. He had listed Sarena as his representation for an auto accident that occurred on November 8, 2022, and Brittany requested confirmation of whether PIP coverage is available. Brittany’s signature block provided her title, contact numbers, email (bclark@aptivahealth.com), website (aptivahealth.com), and the Aptiva Health address (3615 Newburg Road, Louisville, KY 40218), along with a standard confidentiality notice.

At 11:28:54 AM the same day, Monday, January 23, 2023, Sarena M. Tuttle replied to Brittany with reconfirmation that PIP coverage is available for both of Mr. Alif’s incidents. She provided the following insurer details: for MVA on 11/08/2022, Farmers Insurance, contact Michael Santos, phone (248) 488-2779, email MyClaim@FarmersInsurance.com, Claim number 7005284778-1-2; and for MVA on 12/10/2022, American Transit Insurance, contact Chevan Douglas, phone (212) 857-8200 Ext 1624, Claim number 1123215. In her closing, she included her own contact information: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (D) (502) 357-9971; office line (O) (502) 583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noted as the new email address. The email was also cc’d to Shanta Harper (sharper@aptivahealth.com) and carried the subject Re: Muhammad Alif. The message included the standard confidentiality notice typical of firm correspondence.

In summary, the thread establishes that there is PIP coverage available for both of Mr. Alif’s auto accident incidents (11/08/2022 and 12/10/2022), and it provides the specific insurer contacts, claim numbers, and the updated contact email for Sarena Tuttle, along with the relevant parties copied on the communications.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif, whose December 9, 2022 motor vehicle accident occurred in New York. The file records a sequence of correspondence involving Alif and The Whaley Law Firm, with Nona Bacote also copied on one message, regarding insurance coverage, progress with a Progressive claim, and related medical imaging and police documentation.

The first dated item in the Re: Car Accident thread shows an email from Muhammad Alif (stimulus110@yahoo.com) to Serena Tuttle and Aaron Whaley, with Nona Bacote CC’d, sent on January 31, 2023 at 19:33:31 UTC. In that message, he states that he has located a Progressive claim number related to his New York automobile accident. He notes the date of the accident as December 9, 2022, and identifies the vehicle as registered to Mejia Jose. He reports speaking with someone named Virgil at Progressive, who advised that a claim has been filed in New York. He asks the recipients to be aware of the claim number 228451213 and provides the adjuster’s name as Eric Kastar, with a contact phone number of 631-319-4532.

Earlier communications in the chain shed more detail. On January 26, 2023, at 7:18 PM, Nona Bacote wrote to Sarena, relaying that Muhammad Alif had been seen at Envision Imaging that week, located at 12201 Merit Drive, Suite 100, Dallas, Texas 75251. The office there can be reached at (214) 276-0050, with a fax number of (214) 276-0057, and the imaging facility’s website listed as http://www.envivionimg.com. The message notes that an MRI had been ordered but services were refused due to the client’s claustrophobia. Nona also mentions that Muhammad had obtained the police report for the New York accident and asks whether Progressive Insurance has been identified as the insurer.

The next day, January 27, 2023, at 9:28 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Mo (Muhammad) asking him to forward the police report, indicating ongoing coordination. At 9:54 AM, Sarena added that Progressive had been contacted and that they do not insure the defendant in the second accident; she explained that the cab company carries a policy of $25,000/$50,000. She noted that because the cab was not the at-fault driver, the cab company has the right to deny all liability, accept 50% liability, or accept 100% liability, and if they accept 100% liability, the maximum recoverable would be $25,000. She also inquired whether Muhammad had under-insured motorist coverage on his personal policy.

Later, at 10:56 AM on January 27, Sarena sent another update: “I have his copy of the PR. Star faxed it over.” The message confirms that the police report copy had been obtained and shared.

In the same week, Muhammad sent another note on January 27, 2023, at 1:51 PM, stating, “Good afternoon after reviewing my policy it’s been discovered I only had $25,000 on a sewer motors.” This line appears to reflect his understanding of the available limits, though it reads with a likely misprint.

Together, the notes depict an ongoing effort to confirm the insurance coverage for the New York accident (the Progressive claim 228451213 with adjuster Eric Kastar), the involvement of a cab company with a $25k/$50k policy in the second incident, the status of Progressive’s coverage for the defendant in the second accident, and the procurement of the New York police report and medical imaging information (Envision Imaging in Dallas) tied to Muhammad Alif’s case. The communications also show the client’s pursuit of clarity on insurer identification and available coverage, as well as updates regarding the medical imaging decision due to claustrophobia.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

It’s been requested from American transit insurance company for I Muhammad Alif to provide a detailed statement, on December 9. I Muhammad Alif. Was injured while sitting in back of a cab, which was driven by Mr. Peter C Marquez, in the city Ronkonkma located in the state of New York, tag number 18057LY. Taking quite by surprise while riding in the cab, stop at a light I noticed a strong impact of a force, I noticed a sound of a bang, at that point, I realized I was in a lot of pain. I immediately asked the cab driver to call the police upon a police, arriving, he asked, was everyone OK? I told him I was in a lot of pain and I need to go to the hospital. We were already at the airport after the police report was writing I told the police officer that I will go to the hospital once my plane landed in Louisville Kentucky. I went to the hospital. The very next day date was 12/10/23. The witness was Kendra Fogle along with Mr. Marquez.

In an email dated February 4, 2023, from Muhammad Alif (stimulus110@yahoo.com) to Sarena Tuttle (sarena@whaleylawfirm.com), he notes that American Transit Insurance Company requested that he provide a detailed statement, on December 9. He states, “I Muhammad Alif,” and describes being injured while seated in the back of a taxi.

He explains that the taxi was driven by Mr. Peter C Marquez in the city of Ronkonkma, New York, with tag number 18057LY. He recounts that he was taken by surprise during the ride when the cab stopped at a light, heard a bang, and felt a strong impact, after which he realized he was in a lot of pain. He immediately asked the cab driver to call the police. When the police arrived, they asked whether everyone was OK; he told the officer that he was in a lot of pain and needed to go to the hospital. He adds that they were already at the airport, and after the police report was written he informed the officer that he would go to the hospital once his plane landed in Louisville, Kentucky. He later went to the hospital, and the very next day the date was 12/10/23.

The witness listed is Kendra Fogle, along with Mr. Marquez.

__Claim Review for PIP Release__
From: Sarena Tuttle [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: Nona Bacote [nibacote40@verizon.net](mailto:nibacote40@verizon.net), Tristateinjuryandrehab@gmail.com , Muhammad Alif [stimulus110@yahoo.com](mailto:stimulus110@yahoo.com)

Good afternoon Mo,
 I have discussed your claims with Aaron and he is ok with releasing PIP
but requested I get clarification of which PIP you want to release and to
whom. We can release either the PIP from the 11/08 accident, the PIP from
the 12/09 accident or both.
 Please be specific as to which providers you want to release funds
too. If you are releasing PIP to a provider that has provided services for
both accidents, such as Cutting Edge, please further specify which billing
you would like paid.
 Please keep in mind, the 2 providers looking for payment are Starlite
Chiro (Gail advised your billing is over $10,000.00, however, she is
awaiting toner to print a billing statement for you) & Cutting Edge
Medical Services (see attached). Currently, these providers are claiming
over $30,000.00 in medicals to date date.
 Please also understand that there will possibly be outstanding
medical bills to be addressed at the negotiation/settlement of your claims.
We look forward to hearing from you soon with these directions.

Sarena M. Tuttle
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104
E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com

episodes.natural_language:
For case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022, involving client Muhammad Alif, there was a claim review regarding the release of PIP benefits. On Monday, February 6, 2023 at 12:58 PM Eastern, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Nona Bacote, Tristateinjuryandrehab@gmail.com, and Muhammad Alif, with Aaron Whaley CC’ed. The subject was the Release of PIP benefits, and the message outlined the need to specify which PIP release was desired and to whom the funds should be released.

Sarena explained that she had discussed the claims with Aaron, who approved releasing PIP but required clarification on which PIP to release and the recipient(s). The options were to release the PIP from the 11/08 accident, the PIP from the 12/09 accident, or both. She asked for specific instructions on which providers should receive the funds. If a PIP payment is to go to a provider that rendered services for both accidents, such as Cutting Edge, she asked for a further specification of which billing would be paid.

She noted that two providers are currently seeking payment: Starlite Chiro and Cutting Edge Medical Services. Gail from Starlite Chiro advised that the client’s billing is over $10,000.00, though she is awaiting toner to print a billing statement. Cutting Edge Medical Services’ bill is referenced as “see attached.” At the time of the email, these providers were claiming over $30,000.00 in medicals to date. On February 14, 2023, at 12:36:13 PM Eastern Time, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm emailed Muhammad Alif and Aaron Whaley regarding his inquiry about filing a lawsuit. In her message, she explained that filing suit is not the proper course for his claims at this time. The Bodily Injury Carrier for his claims has accepted liability, and they are simply awaiting the completion of treatment. Once treatment is finished and all of his records and bills have been obtained, they will proceed with the proper Demand Process. If, during the negotiation phase, the bodily injury carrier is not willing to make a reasonable offer, Aaron Whaley will review the file for potential litigation. She emphasized that litigation is very expensive and lengthy and should not be undertaken lightly, and that at this time they will not be filing a civil suit. She invited him to contact the firm with any further questions, and provided her contact information, noting a new email address: Sarena M. Tuttle, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, D: (502) 357-9971, O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

The email also included a forwarded sequence from the client. Earlier that day, at 9:38 AM, Muhammad Alif wrote: “Good morning Counselor how are you? I am very disturbed about these automobile accident cases, and I am requesting that you file a lawsuit against the harbor house, the owner of the commercial vehicle in accident number one, it’s been 90 days now and we still don’t have any information on policy limits. I know insurance companies like to play games and I’m asking you to push the envelope to file a lawsuit.” The message was sent from Yahoo Mail for iPad. episodes.natural_language:
Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022 involved a call to the client, Muhammad Alif, to obtain details about RS per Companion. The client stated that he did not call the insurance company; Gail did. Gail was advised that a PIP RS is required before any payments would be issued. Gail spoke with “Arianna” and was told that Arianna is not an adjuster, and any conversation about such matters should be routed through our office. Neither Gail nor the client should be scheduling RS or discussing any claim details. I advised the client to stop calling the insurance companies—the only office he should be speaking with is our office.

The client reassured me that he is done and out of it. I also asked the client to stop discussing the claim with Companion, as such discussions could cause us to speak about his claim, which is confidential, and we should not be discussing his claims with anyone other than him, and vice versa.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022. The client is Muhammad Alif.

On March 13, 2023, the EUO matter for Muhammad Alif (EUO #1123215-01) was the subject of an external email with the header Re: [EXTERNAL] Muhammad Alif EUO #1123215-01. The note shows the case as Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022 and indicates the client is Muhammad Alif. The initial line in the note reads simply “No.”, after which the email thread is presented.

At 1:51 PM on March 13, 2023, Aaron Whaley of the Whaley Law Firm in Louisville, Kentucky, sent an email to Haylei M. Spencer (HSpencer@american-transit.com) and to Muhammad Alif at muhammadalifmvaz3105436@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, with the subject “[EXTERNAL] Muhammad Alif EUO #1123215-01.” In his message, Whaley wrote: “Haylei, I hope this email finds you well. I am confirming tomorrow's EUO of Muhammad Alif. Please forward the zoom information. Thank you.” The email included Whaley’s signature block, listing the Whaley Law Firm address at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, and the phone number 502-583-4022. It also contained a confidentiality notice stating that the email and attachments are for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information, and that any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited; if not the intended recipient, the recipient should contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the email and its attachments. The firm’s contact information appears again under the closing, including the address and phone number.

Later in the thread, at approximately 1:57 PM, Haylei Spencer-Roach of the No Fault Legal Department replied: “Noted. Zoom confirmed – will your client need an interpreter?” Her message also included the No Fault Legal Department’s policy note: “Company Policy regarding Examination Under Oath: As indicated on the EUO notice, we request a forty eight (48) business hours prior to confirmation.” She signed the message as Haylei Spencer-Roach, No Fault Legal Department, with the EUOScheduling email address EUOScheduling@american-transit.com and the contact number 212-857-8200 EXT 1625. An image (cid:image001.png@01D48D6C.A564D460) accompanied the signature.

In summary, the exchange centers on coordinating Muhammad Alif’s EUO for the December 10, 2022 motor vehicle accident (MVA), with Whaley requesting tomorrow’s EUO Zoom details, and Spencer confirming Zoom and noting interpreter considerations and the company’s 48-business-hour confirmation policy.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Called Client about Admin situation on MRs - Client asked about Claim & what his options are - Referred him to have a sit down with AW to go over everything as I have explained to the best of my ability - Client wants to pick & choose which injuries are attributed to which incident - Explained to Client again that he does not get to pick & choose - Explained that the Insurance companies will look at the extent of the damage to the vehicle & decide which injuries are attributable - This claim has minimal to minor damage, where as his 1st accident was minor to moderate damage, making his injuries more attributable to the 1st accident. - Explained to Client that AW is doing his best to attribute injuries & damages appropriately but can not force the insurance to change position without additional/new information - Further explained that additional/new information can only be obtained by settlement of the 1st accident and concrete decision on which injuries are related/not related - Client expressed better understanding after analogy of assault (I hit him with a bat & pole, month later Gail open hand smacks him. He does not complain of back injury when I hit him, but does after Gail smacks him. Gail's insurance will say his back injury is due to my assault not Gail's regardless of when he complained of back pain) 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: December 19 2024
episodes.natural_language:
Muhammad Alif, the client in case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022, was contacted on December 19, 2024, by Sarena to discuss the administrative situation on MRs. The client asked about the claim and what his options are, and Sarena referred him to have a sit-down with AW to go over everything as she had explained to the best of her ability.

The client expressed a desire to pick and choose which injuries were attributed to which incident. Sarena explained again that he does not get to pick and choose, and that the insurance companies will look at the extent of the damage to the vehicle and decide which injuries are attributable. This claim has minimal to minor damage, whereas his first accident was minor to moderate damage, making his injuries more attributable to the first accident. Sarena explained that AW is doing his best to attribute injuries and damages appropriately but cannot force the insurance to change position without additional/new information. She further explained that additional/new information can only be obtained by settlement of the first accident and a concrete decision on which injuries are related/not related. The client expressed better understanding after an analogy of assault: I hit him with a bat & pole, month later Gail open hand smacks him. He does not complain of back injury when I hit him, but does after Gail smacks him. Gail's insurance will say his back injury is due to my assault not Gail's regardless of when he complained of back pain.
episodes.author: Filevine Integration

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022

Settlement Negotiation Call with Progressive Adjuster Natasha Fortune:

Aaron Whaley spoke with Natasha Fortune (Progressive Insurance, 518-560-3853) regarding settlement negotiations for Mr. Alif's claim.

KEY POINTS:
- Progressive's final offer: $3,500 (confirmed as highest amount available)
- Previous offer clarification: Last offer on record was $3,250 (not $3,800 as previously thought)
- Aaron has authority to negotiate up to $5,000 but will need to consult with client regarding the $3,500 offer
- Treatment records concern: Aaron noted that the 813 pages of documentation do not solely pertain to treatment prior to the accident in question - will review records further before proceeding
- Natasha requested courtesy notice if legal action is filed

NEXT STEPS:
1. Aaron will discuss the $3,500 settlement offer with client
2. Review treatment records to address Progressive's concerns about pre-existing treatment
3. If filing legal action, send courtesy notice to Natasha Fortune

episodes.natural_language:
Case Muhammad-Alif-MVA-12-09-2022 concerns client Muhammad Alif. In December 2022, the Medical Records Organization for this case was completed. The process involved organizing 142 loose files into provider folders, with 110 files successfully sorted into 20 provider folders. Thirty-two files were moved to the _NEEDS_REVIEW/ folder due to ambiguous provider names. Sorting was automated based on file name patterns, and there was zero data loss.

The Unified Client Folder was updated to reside at /projects/Muhammad-Alif-Client-Medical-Records/ and now contains records from both accidents (November 2022 and December 2022). Sixty-six organized files from the December case were added to the unified folder.

Provider overlap shows that eight providers were treated for both accidents: Aptiva Health, Cutting Edge Orthopedics, Innovation Open MRI, Lynn Family Sports & Vision Training, Mayo Spine Clinic, Parkridge Medical Center, Starlite Chiropractic, and Baptist Health.

Files Needing Review comprise 32 files in the _NEEDS_REVIEW/ folder: 12 files with a generic 'Norton' label (the specific Norton facility needs identification) and 20 files with a generic 'Provider' label (the actual provider needs identification).

Next steps include reviewing the _NEEDS_REVIEW/ folder to identify the correct providers, consolidating Parkridge/Park Ridge variants and Baptist Health variants, updating the unified client folder after review, and performing cross-accident causation analysis.

Reports Generated for this case include Muhammad_Alif_Dual_Accident_Organization_Plan.md and Muhammad_Alif_Organization_Complete_Report.md.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
